saf.core.ui.dock

Interface DockingManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultDockingManager

    public interface DockingManager
    Interface for classes that manage dockable frames.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getBarManager

        GUIBarManager getBarManager()
        Gets the bar manager that manages the tool, menu and status bars.
        Returns:
        the bar manager that manages the tool, menu and status bars.

      • dock

        void dock(DockableFrame dockable,
        DockableFrame target)
        Attempts to dock the specified dockable to the target, stacking the dockable on top of the target. This will do nothing if the target is minimized or the dockable has not been added to a group.
        Parameters:
        dockable - the dockable to dock
        target - the target to dock to

      • dock

        void dock(DockableFrame dockable,
        DockableFrame relativeTo,
        Location location,
        float fillPercent)
        Attempts to dock the specified dockable in some location relative to another dockable. This will not work if relativeTo is minimized or maximized, or if the dockable hasn't been added to a group yet.
        Parameters:
        dockable - the dockable to dock
        relativeTo - the dockable to dock relative to
        location - the relative location
        fillPercent - the fill percent that the dockable should take up

      • addDockableToGroup

        void addDockableToGroup(java.lang.String perspectiveID,
                      java.lang.String groupID,
                      DockableFrame dockable)
        Adds the specified dockable to the specified group in the specified perspective.
        Parameters:
        perspectiveID - the id of the perspective to add the dockable to
        groupID - the id of the group to add the dockable to
        dockable - the dockable to add

      • getGroupIDs

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getGroupIDs(java.lang.String perspectiveID)
        Gets the group ids of the groups in the specified perspective.
        Parameters:
        perspectiveID - the perspective whose groups are of interest
        Returns:
        group ids of the groups in the specified perspective

      • getDockableFrames

        java.util.List<DockableFrame> getDockableFrames(java.lang.String perspectiveID,
                                              java.lang.String groupID)
        Gets all the dockables in the specified group in the specified perspective.
        Parameters:
        perspectiveID - the id of the perspective
        groupID - the id the group
        Returns:
        all the dockables in the specified group in the specified perspective.

      • createDockable

        DockableFrame createDockable(java.lang.String id,
                           javax.swing.JComponent comp)
        Creates a Dockable with the specified id containing the specified component. This only creates the dockable. To add a created dockable into a window use the addDockableToGroup method.
        Parameters:
        id - the id that uniquely identifies the created Dockable
        comp - the component displayed by the dockable
        Returns:
        the created dockable
        See Also:
        addDockableToGroup(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, saf.core.ui.dock.DockableFrame)

      • createDockable

        DockableFrame createDockable(java.lang.String id,
                           javax.swing.JComponent comp,
                           DockingManager.MinimizeLocation hideLocation)
        Creates a dockable with the specified id, hide location and containing the specified component. This only creates the dockable. To add a created dockable into a window use the addDockableToGroup method.

        Parameters:
        id - the id that uniquely identifies the created Dockable
        comp - the component displayed by the dockable
        hideLocation - the location where the dockable is minimized to
        Returns:
        the created dockable

      • createDockable

        DockableFrame createDockable(java.lang.String id,
                           javax.swing.JComponent comp,
                           DockingManager.MinimizeLocation location,
                           int dockableControls)
        Creates a dockable with the specified id, hide location, window controls and containing the specified component. This only creates the dockable. To add a created dockable into a window use the addDockableToGroup method.

        The dockable controls are:

        • DockingManager.CLOSE
        • DockingManager.HIDE
        • DockingManager.MAXIMIZE
        • DockingManager.FLOAT
        These can be logically or'ed together.
        Parameters:
        id - the id that uniquely identifies the created Dockable
        comp - the component displayed by the dockable
        location - the location where the dockable is minimized to
        dockableControls - specifies what controls (close, maximize, float etc.) are displayed on the dockable's title bar
        Returns:
        the created dockable

      • init

        void init()
        Initializes the docking manger by activitating the current perpspective.
